decks.notes: The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and maintaining board presence. By utilizing a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive spells, the deck aims to control the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. Cards like Shark Typhoon and Uro provide card advantage and threats, while Zareth San and Lochmere Serpent offer alternative win conditions. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure smooth mana development and consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Lotus Cobra and Fabled Passage to bring out powerful threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Spikefield Hazard and Genesis Ultimatum while setting up for big plays with cards like Felidar Retreat and Terror of the Peaks. The deck also includes ways to generate card advantage with cards like Escape to the Wilds and Kenrith, the Returned King.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Lotus Cobra and Cultivate, and then cast powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Omnath, Locus of Creation to gain a significant advantage over the opponent. The deck also utilizes control elements such as Confounding Conundrum and Spikefield Hazard to disrupt the opponent's plans. Overall, the goal is to efficiently ramp up mana, control the board, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game early on with removal spells and counter magic, while ramping up your mana with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra. Once you hit your land drops, you can unleash powerful ramp spells like Genesis Ultimatum to put multiple threats on the board. Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath are key finishers that can overwhelm your opponent with their powerful abilities. The deck aims to outvalue your opponent and end the game with big threats like Terror of the Peaks.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful adventure cards. By utilizing cards like Lucky Clover and Fae of Wishes, you can generate extra value from your adventures and pull ahead in the game. Omnath, Locus of Creation serves as a strong finisher, dealing damage and gaining life when you play multiple lands in a turn. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game with a mix of creatures and spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Adventure mechanic to create a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle. By using cards like Lucky Clover and Fae of Wishes, the deck aims to generate extra value and advantage from Adventure cards. Omnath, Locus of Creation serves as a powerful finisher, while Beanstalk Giant provides a strong threat and ramp potential. The inclusion of creatures like Edgewall Innkeeper and Bonecrusher Giant help maintain board presence and control. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creature plays and versatile options.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly deplete their life total. The key focus is on deploying threats early, leveraging the synergy between creatures like Fervent Champion, Bonecrusher Giant, and Anax, Hardened in the Forge with powerful equipment such as Embercleave. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Castle Embereth and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell enhances the deck's ability to close out games quickly by maximizing damage output.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disruption and removal, while also utilizing powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to control the board and generate value. The deck aims to control the game through counter spells, removal spells, and hand disruption, while also having powerful planeswalkers like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse to close out the game. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all three colors, allowing the deck to comfortably cast its spells and threats.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of the Adventure mechanic to generate card advantage and efficient creatures while ramping into powerful threats. By using cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck can double up on the value of Adventure cards like Beanstalk Giant and Bonecrusher Giant. Omnath, Locus of Creation serves as a strong finisher while Escape to the Wilds provides additional card advantage and mana ramp. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and versatility.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of control and aggressive elements from the Dimir color combination to quickly disrupt and pressure the opponent. By efficiently removing threats with spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Heartless Act, countering important plays with Negate and Mystical Dispute, and applying pressure with creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Nadir Kraken, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win through a mix of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on using mill effects to force the opponent to draw through their deck quickly, while also controlling the board through removal and countermagic. Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Merfolk Secretkeeper, and Ruin Crab provide consistent mill effects, while cards like Clearwater Pathway and Fabled Passage ensure smooth mana fixing. Bloodchief's Thirst and Drown in the Loch handle threats efficiently, while So Tiny and Hagra Mauling can deal with larger creatures. Into the Story and Silundi Vision provide card advantage, with Maddening Cacophony being a powerful finisher. Soul-Guide Lantern, Mystical Dispute, and Cling to Dust offer additional disruption and graveyard hate.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using powerful green creatures and efficient removal spells. By ramping up with mana producers like Castle Garenbrig and using cards like The Great Henge to draw cards and gain life, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also pressuring them with large threats like Gemrazer and Stonecoil Serpent. Additionally, cards like Primal Might and Ram Through provide removal options to clear the way for attacks, making this deck formidable in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana by utilizing cards like Lotus Cobra and Gilded Goose, while controlling the board with cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Felidar Retreat. The key strategy involves playing powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Escape to the Wilds to generate card advantage and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out the game before the opponent can recover.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Lotus Cobra and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to play powerful, high-cost creatures and spells early on. Omnath, Locus of Creation is a key card in this strategy, allowing you to gain more mana and draw cards when you play lands. Control elements like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Spikefield Hazard help you maintain board control while cards like Genesis Ultimatum and Escape to the Wilds provide additional card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of ramp and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game while ramping up mana to quickly play powerful spells and creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Terror of the Peaks. By using cards like Genesis Ultimatum and Escape to the Wilds, the deck aims to generate card advantage and overwhelm the opponent with big plays. Cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Lotus Cobra help ramp up mana quickly, while cards like Spikefield Hazard and Mystical Dispute provide disruption and protection against the opponent's plays.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra to cast powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The goal is to control the board with cards like Confounding Conundrum and Spikefield Hazard while generating value with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Felidar Retreat. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big plays and efficient mana usage, ultimately leading to victory through sheer power and card advantage.
